intro: Henckelia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
